events.message: Customer reported a vehicle accident involving a rear-end collision on the highway and filed the initial claim with basic details.
The claim was reviewed and assigned to the Auto Accident category based on the description of a car collision provided by the customer.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to handle all communications and assist the customer through the claim process.
The claim was acknowledged by the insurance company with confirmation sent to the customer, ensuring the start of the claim process.
The agent requested the customer to submit the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates as supporting documents.
Customer uploaded all requested documents including the police report and several photos showing the collision damage to the vehicle.
The insurance company initiated a formal investigation to verify the details of the accident and assess liability and damages.
Investigation concluded, confirming the accident details and validating the claim with findings favoring the insured customer.
A settlement offer was prepared and communicated to the customer outlining the compensation amount for vehicle repairs.
Customer responded positively to the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling of the claim.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance company, confirming the settlement terms and preparing for payment issuance.
The approved settlement amount was processed and payment issued to the customerâ€™s bank account to cover vehicle repair costs.
With payment completed and all formalities done, the insurance claim was officially closed to the satisfaction of the customer.
